data.title: Anastasia Nikolaevna (Grand Duchess of Russia)
data.meta_description: Anastasia Nikolaevna was the youngest daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, the last ruler of Imperial Russia, and his wife, Tsarina Alexandra Feodorovna.
data.text:
Full Name: Velikaya Knyazhna Anastasiya Nikolayevna Romanova

Profession: Grand Duchess of Russia

Biography: Anastasia Nikolaevna was the youngest daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, the last ruler of Imperial Russia, and his wife, Tsarina Alexandra Feodorovna. Her older sisters were the Grand Duchesses Olga, Tatiana, and Maria Romanova.

The Romanov family had been held prisoner following the February Revolution in 1917. Nikolaevna was killed along with her family by a group of Bolshevik revolutionaries in Yekaterinburg in July 1918, along with members of their entourage who had accompanied them into imprisonment.

There have since been rumors of their survival, with several women claiming to be Anastasia Nikolaevna. One such impostor was Anna Anderson, who was proven to be unrelated to the Romanovs by a posthumous DNA test in 1994.

Born: June 18, 1901

Birthplace: Saint Petersburg, Russia

Generation: Greatest Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Ox

Star Sign: Gemini

Died: July 17, 1918 (aged 17)

Cause of Death: Executed

Articles and Photos

Execution of the Romanovs

The basement room in Ipatiev House where the Romanov royal family and their staff were executed. The holes in the walls are from investigators searching for bullets.

Historical Events

The Romanov royal family and several of their retainers are executed by a Bolshevik firing squad in the basement of Ipatiev House, in Yekaterinburg, Siberia

Famous Russians
